subject: p17770657
History: PICC placement and possible subcutaneous gas.
Findings: In comparison with the study of, the PICC line appears to be in the mid to lower portion of the SVC. The overall appearance of the heart and lungs is essentially unchanged, though there is an artifact overlying a portion of the right lung. Continued hyperexpansion of the lungs consistent with emphysema. Atelectatic changes are seen at both bases. The possibility of supervening consolidation in the posterior aspect of one of the lower lobes would be difficult to unequivocally exclude in the appropriate clinical setting.
